name.en: Remote sensing and air quality applications

goal.ch: 本課程設計為提供一個廣泛的了解目前衛星遙測技術提供的產品及其實際的應用，針對修課學生的研究課題，加強未來可用的衛星資料處理。
goal.en: This course is designed to provide an overview of types of remote sensing data available for use in air quality applications and their utility including the main aerosol and trace gas products.

outline.ch: 本課程會提供多組的衛星資料讓學生進行分析，同時課程中會介紹衛星資料處理的原理及反演的方法，幾個個案研究會應用在課程中，整個課程的設計主要希望學生有信心應用衛星資料。
outline.en: Hands on activities are designed to give a first exposure to remote sensing data from several sensors including websites which allow online data analysis, access to imagery and data, and several reference websites. Lectures and discussions are intended to facilitate proper understanding and use of the data products including the theoretical basis underlying the creation of the products. This course ends with a hands-on air quality event case study to provide an opportunity to review the materials presented during the course and illustrate how to conceptually analyze an event. Throughout the course, students will be assigned four homeworks and given a topic to write a term paper based on their specific interests. The course will help graduate students confidently learn how to use remote sensing data in their research.
